parameters.description: Code used for authorization code grant, token used for implicit grant.
parameters.name: response_type

parameters.description: The client id of the application.
parameters.name: client_id

parameters.description: The uri to redirect to after authorization. Defined when registering the application.
parameters.name: redirect_uri

parameters.description: The scope of the application.
parameters.name: scope

parameters.description: (Optional) Used to prevent CSRF attacks.
parameters.name: state

parameters.description: (Optional) Used to prevent replay attacks.
parameters.name: nonce

post.summary: Individual user or installer logs in to obtain an access token and refresh token for accessing the APIs described in this documentation.
Individual user or installer refreshes the access token using the refresh token.

get.summary: Get the list of chargers that the user can use.
get.description:
Only end users of charger can get the list of chargers.

Including the invited chargers.

get.summary: Get the detail of the charger's data.
get.description: User and installer or charger can get the detail of the charger.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

400.description: Some conditions of the action are not met. Such as the device is offline.

get.summary: Get the current status and configuration details of the charger.
get.description: User and installer or charger can get the detail of the charger.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

400.description: Some conditions of the action are not met. Such as the device is offline.

post.summary: Start a charging session as the current user.
post.description: Only end users of chargers can start the charging session via thia api.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

400.description: Some conditions of the action are not met. Such as the device is offline.

post.summary: Stop the charging session as the current user.
post.description:
Only end users of chargers can stop the charging session via thia api.

Role owner can stop all charging sessions, role user can only stop their own charging session.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

post.summary: Set the current limit of the charger.
post.description:
User and installer or charger can get the detail of the charger.

Only the role owner or installer can set the current limit.

Note1: The value to set must be less than or equal to the circuit fuse.

Note2: The final output current limit of the charger is the minimum value of circuit's fuse, cable_current_limit, current_limit and the approved value of load balancing (only need to be judged when load balancing is enabled).

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

400.description: Some conditions of the action are not met. Such as the device is offline.

get.summary: Get the schedule details of the charger.
get.description: Only the role owner can get the schedule detail.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

put.summary: Update a schedule item for the charger with the specified schedule mode.
put.description:
Only the role owner can update the schedule.

If a schedule already exists at schedule_index, update the schedule.

If schedule_index == the current number of schedules, indicating a new schedule.

If repeat_days is empty, the schedule is a one-time schedule. It would automatically be disabled after the scheduled action is completed.

Number of schedules: 2 for schedule_charge, 1 for off_peak.

delete.summary: Delete a schedule item from the charger based on the specified schedule mode.
delete.description: Only the role owner can delete the schedule.

put.summary: Update the schedule configuration of the charger.
put.description:
Only the role owner can update the schedule config.

Only when uk_reg is equal to True can schedule_mode be switched to off_peak mode.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

get.summary: List charger sessions. Installer and Owner can get all sessions. Invited users can only retrieve sessions they have initiated themselves.
get.description: Sessions are included in the response if its end_timestamp falls within the given from_date and to_date interval.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Interval start time. ISO8601 datetime.

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Interval end time. ISO8601 datetime.

get.summary: Retrieve aggregated energy consumption for a charger.
get.description:
Only the role owner or installer can access this data.

Note: The actual results depend on the chosen granularity.
For example, with granularity=hourly, a query from 09:30 to 10:30 will return data for 09:00–10:00 and 10:00–11:00.
All times are in UTC.

parameters.name: charger_id
parameters.description: The charger id, which is the same as the sn of the charger.

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Start time of the interval (ISO8601, UTC).

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: End time of the interval (ISO8601, UTC).

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: Data aggregation granularity. Allowed values: hourly, daily. Maximum interval: 60 days.

info.title: NexBlue OpenAPI
info.description:
This is the API documentation for NexBlue's OpenAPI.
## Authorization
To access protected resources, an access_token is required for authentication.

There are two methods for obtaining an access token, corresponding to different client integration approaches:

For official enterprise third-party clients, OAuth 2.0 is used to authorize NexBlue user permissions, enabling functionalities such as collecting energy consumption data for accurate billing and fee processing.

For individual NexBlue users, they can directly obtain a token by using their username and password, enabling more flexible and automated access to the APIs described in this documentation, allowing users to personalize data retrieval and control their devices.

- **access_token**: Used to access the protected resources. Include it in the header with key `Authorization` and the value `<access_token>`. Access token would expire in 1 day.
- **refresh_token**: Used to obtain a new access_token at the token endpoint without re-authorization. Refresh token would expire in 30 days.

> Note that if the access token expires or is invalid, a 401 Unauthorized error will be returned.

### OAuth2.0
URL path prefix `/third_party/openapi/oauth2` is for OAuth2.0 authorization.

If a client wants to access the API through OAuth2.0 authorization, they must contact NexBlue to register and obtain their `client_id`, `client_secret`, define the required `scope`, and set the `redirect_uri`, among other details.

When redirecting to the authorization endpoint, it is important to ensure that the `client_id`, `client_secret`, and `redirect_uri` match the registered values.

After successful authorization, the client will receive either an authorization code or an access token, depending on the chosen authorization flow.

- **code**: Used to obtain an access_token from the token endpoint.

### Individual NexBlue Users
Currently, NexBlue offers two types of public accounts: end users of chargers and installers of chargers. These two account types are independent of each other.

Both end users and installers can obtain their own access_token by using their username and password.

However, different APIs may either allow access to both account types, restrict access to only one, or behave differently depending on the account type.

Please refer to the specific API documentation for detailed information on access permissions and functional differences.

## API
All API prefixes are `/third_party/openapi`.

For example:
- `/third_party/openapi/chargers/{charger_id}`: Get the detailed information of the charger.

> If the request returns a 403 Forbidden error, it is likely due to an incorrect URL or HTTP method.

### Charger Commands API
Since command API requests are forwarded to the device, they are only supported when the device is online.

If the device is offline, an error response will be returned.

GrantType.title: GrantType
GrantType.description:
authorization_code = authorization_code

refresh_token = refresh_token

client_credentials = client_credentials

client_id.description: According to the OAuth 2.0 specification, the client_id and client_secret should be transmitted using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme. However, to ensure compatibility with clients that do not support Basic Authentication, it is also acceptable to allow these credentials to be submitted in the POST form body.

client_secret.description: According to the OAuth 2.0 specification, the client_id and client_secret should be transmitted using the HTTP Basic authentication scheme. However, to ensure compatibility with clients that do not support Basic Authentication, it is also acceptable to allow these credentials to be submitted in the POST form body.

redirect_uri.description: Must be the same redirect_uri that was used to get authorization_code in authorize endpoint. You must provide this parameter if grant_type is authorization_code.

refresh_token.description: To generate new access and ID tokens for a user's session, set the value of a refresh_token parameter in your /oauth2/token request to a previously issued refresh token from the same app client.

code.description: The authorization code from an authorization code grant. You must provide this parameter if your authorization request included a grant_type of authorization_code.

access_token.description: The token used for API calls. Include this token in the Authorization header when accessing protected resources.

refresh_token.description: The token used to refresh the access_token, valid for 30 days. Only returned when using the authorization_code grant type.

expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access_token, in seconds. Default is 3600 seconds.

token_type.description: Type of the token. Always set to Bearer.

username.description: The user’s username, which is the registered email address.

password.description: The password associated with the username.

access_token.description: The token used for API calls. Include this token in the Authorization header when accessing protected resources.

expires_in.description: Lifetime of the access_token, in seconds. Default is 3600 seconds.

token_type.description: Type of the token. Always set to Bearer.

is_collection.description: Whether the charger is part of a collection.

data.description: The list of data related to the charger.

device_operator_type.description:
The operator type of the charger.

0 = NexBlue

1 = Enegic

2 = NexBlueZen

3 = OCPP

ocpp_data.description: OCPP-specific data for the charger. Only returned for OCPP chargers.

ChargerStatus.title: ChargerStatus
ChargerStatus.description:
0 = idle

1 = connected

2 = charging

3 = finished

4 = error

5 = lb_waiting

6 = delay_waiting

7 = ev_waiting

protocol_version.description: The protocol version of the charger.

charging_state.description:
The current charging state of the charger.

0 = idle

1 = connected

2 = charging

3 = finished

4 = error

5 = lb_waiting

6 = delay_waiting

7 = ev_waiting

voltage_list.description: The list of voltages for each phase. 0~255. Contains three items, each indicating one phase voltage respectively. Unit: V

current_list.description: The list of currents for each phase. Contains three items, each indicating one phase current respectively. Unit: A

energy.description: The energy consumed by the current charging session. Unit: KWh

lifetime_energy.description: The lifetime energy consumed by the charger. Unit: KWh

network_status.description:
The network status of the charger.

0 = none

1 = wifi

2 = lte

3 = ethernet

power.description: The current power output of the charger. Unit: KW

cable_current.description: The cable current limit of the charger. 0~32. If 0, the cable is not plugged. Unit: A

circuit_fuse.description: The fuse of the circuit. Unit: A

current_limit.description: The current limit of the charger. Unit: A

is_always_lock.description:
The cable lock mode of the charger.

0 = lock_while_charging

1 = always_locked

plug_and_charging.description:
The access level of the charger.

0 = authorized_users_only

1 = no_restrictions

force_single.description:
The phase charging mode of the charger.

0 = three_phase

1 = single_phase

brightness.description: The brightness percentage of the charger. 0~100.

uk_reg.description: Whether the UK regulations config is enabled. Only reg_uk equals True can switch switch to offpeak mode.

ChargingControlResEnum.title: ChargingControlResEnum
ChargingControlResEnum.description:
0 = success

1 = unknown_status

2 = permission_denied

3 = rcd_check_failed

4 = disabled

5 = occupied_by_others

result.description:
The result of the operation.

0 = success

1 = unknown_status

2 = permission_denied

3 = rcd_check_failed

4 = disabled

5 = occupied_by_others

current_limit.description: The current limit to set for the charger. 6~32. Unit: A

result.description:
The result of the operation. 0: Success, 1: Fail

0 = success

1 = fail

start_hour.description: The start hour of the schedule. 0~23.

start_minute.description: The start minute of the schedule. 0~59.

stop_hour.description: The end hour of the schedule. 0~23.

stop_minute.description: The end minute of the schedule. 0~59.

repeat_days.description: The list of days the schedule repeats on. 1: Monday ... 7: Sunday. available values: 1~7.

enabled.description: Whether the schedule item is enabled.

schedule_mode.description:
schedule_charge: The charger will start and stop charging at the specified time. Up to two items.
 offpeak: Similar to schedule_charge, but the charger will wait for a random time period, up to 30 minutes, before starting charging when the start charging time is reached. Up to 1 item. Only allowed to change to this mode when the uk_reg attribute of the location is True.
 eco: After the device is plugged in, the server will calculate a low-price charging schedule based on the user's eco configuration. Currently cannot be enabled through the API.

0 = off_peak

1 = eco

2 = schedule_charge

uk_reg.description: Whether the UK regulations config is enabled. Only reg_uk equals True can schedule be switched to offpeak mode.

charge_schedules.description: The list of schedule_charge item. Normal schedule. Number of items: 0~2.

offpeak_schedules.description: The list of offpeak schedule item. Offpeak schedule. Number of items: 0~1.

schedule_mode.description:
The schedule mode to switch.

0 = off_peak

2 = schedule_charge

result.description:
The result of the operation.

0 = success

1 = fail

255 = other_fail

schedule_index.description: The index of the schedule item to update. Failed if the index is not found.
The index of the schedule item to delete.

year.description: The year of the consumption data.

month.description: The month of the consumption data.

day.description: The day of the consumption data.

hour.description: The hour of the consumption data.

date.description: The date of the consumption data.

data.description: The list of consumption aggregation data.

The granularity of the consumption data aggregation.

hourly = hourly

daily = daily

total.description: The total consumption data in the interval. Unit: KWh

value.msg: current limit should be less than or equal to circuit fuse
schedule mode not supported for this operation
schedule count exceed limit, charge_schedules allowed at most 2, off_peak allowed at most 1

schedule index error. Delete schedule api: this error means there is no schedule on this index; Update schedule api: this error means the position is greater than the number of schedules in the current schedule mode

UnauthorizedError.description: Please use a valid access token and pass it in the header with key Authorization, value Bearer <access_token>.
Unauthorized. Please use a valid access token and pass it in the header with key Authorization, value Bearer <access_token>.
